Body:
Fiware Cepheus home page says that its branch is archived and 'read only' now. https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/fiware-cepheus So does it mean: 1. There would be no future support and development in this community? 2. As alternative we should use 'Perseo' as its similar in functionality https://perseo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

"

In general, archiving a GitHub project means that the project is no longer actively maintained.https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-archiving-repositories

The Fiware Cepheus page also states that "no new features will be added
column9:
nor issues fixed by the original team." So this means option 1 is the answer to your question.

There exists 21 forks of this project
column10:
so perhaps the community is moving over to one of those?

I am not familiar with 'Perseo'
column11:
so I cannot tell you if option 2 is a good solution or not.

"

Body:
Yes, further information can be found in the FIWARE 7.4 Release Note

As announced at the Porto Global Summit 2018
column9:
five generic enablers were placed under analysis and have subsequently been removed:

  • Proton
column13:
Aeron IoT Broker

Perseo is the now the preferred generic enabler for complex event processing
column14:
replacing Proton and Cepheus. 3D-UI. FiVES and Aeron are no longer seen to be a good fit with the FIWARE project.

If you want to use Complex Event Processing you are left with two choices:

  1. Convert your project to use Perseo and continue to enjoy community support and development.
  2. Continue to use an archived CEP processor
column15: fork it and make further bug fixes on your own. "

Body: Thanks all for your valuable comments.
